title: IMF report will be studied for next step : Semasinghe
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); State Minister Shehan Semasinghe says that the report released by the International Monetary Fund regarding Sri Lanka regaining its debt sustainability will be studied.

Accordingly, the Minister stated that the President, Prime Minister and Members of the Cabinet will also take steps to discuss the report, which will be followed by steps taken to regain Sri Lanka’s debt sustainability.
Moreover, he said that the relevant report on Sri Lanka will be tabled in Parliament soon as well.
The State Minister adds that the President has begun preliminary discussions with the IMF when he met its representatives recently.
